content: i designed this sweater specifically for the january 2012 afghans for afghans youth campaign like most wool-loving knitters i ve accumulated quite a stash of beautiful wool oddballs and this piece is a great way to put them to use especially for us a4a knitters who d love to make sweaters for kids but find it hard to spring for the cost of all that wool if your yarn is in all different colors i recommend alternating colors every two row i bought a couple of balls of variegated patons classic wool specifically for this project alternating row with leftover wool yarns the base yarn helped keep some continuity in the colors whether or not you decide to buy new yarn is entirely up to you i adapted this pattern from the yoke sweater templates found in the knitter s handy book of sweater patterns by ann budd it s knit from the bottom-up and joined as you go with garter stitch borders so raid your stash and have fun
